D.7 Informality The process should be kept as informal as appropriate to the circumstances of the dispute. Formal rules, as applied in a court of law, need not be followed. The parties should be allowed to present their own positions, arguments and evidence and to hear or see the substantive part of those of the other party, although a dispute resolver can limit the evidence, if it is irrelevant or repetitive.
